thread.title: Rugby fans air travel frustrations on their way home
thread.title_full: Rugby fans air travel frustrations on their way home | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Rugby fans air travel frustrations on their way home
text:
Rugby fans heading out of Cardiff this evening have taken to Twitter to air their frustrations over the availability of trains.
It follows disruption before the Ireland v Canada match today, which saw some fans make it to the Millennium Stadium with only minutes before kick off.
First Great Western have apologised, saying they 'underestimated' the number of people wanting to travel.
Chris @30watching Follow Well done #rwc2015 , @ nationalrailenq , #Cardiff #MillenniumStadium @ fgw for planning ahead.... http://t.co/E2e5zPSvhH
17:56 - 19 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Arriva Trains Wales says it is working to get fans home as quickly as possible, with more than 10,000 people passing through Cardiff Central station.
Arriva Trains Wales @ArrivaTW Follow We've had 10k people back through Cardiff Central so far this evening and we're working to get you all home ASAP. http://t.co/XDyhXqkWxW
18:04 - 19 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Last updated Sat 19 Sep 2015 Read more 8 updates First Great Western apologises to rugby fans for train delays Travel Rugby World Cup 2015 Cardiff Wales
